title: Business Developer Job at Opay
content:
OPay is a mobile money platform operated by OPay Digital Services Limited and licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria. Launched in June 2018, the company has spread its services across all 36 states in Nigeria with over 500,000 mobile money merchants. We are more than a payment company. We believe everyone should be able to enjoy financial and social inclusion, without regard for physical borders, boundaries, or even social status. OPay is a one-stop mobile-based platform for payment and other important services in your everyday life. Millions of users rely on OPay every day to send and receive money and pay bills.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Developer
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Locations: Keffi - Nasarawa & Suleja - Niger

Description


	The business development officer will be responsible for driving user adoption of our digital products ( E-wallets, cards, etc.) and customer acquisition in various locations or regions, developing strategies to increase transaction product utilization.


Key Responsibilities


	Have a good understanding of the business products or services and be able to advise others about the advantages of our product.
	Research and identify new business opportunities - including new markets, growth areas, trends, customers, partnerships, and individuals.
	Meet with customers/clients face-to-face.
	Develop relationships with old and new customers/clients.
	Work strategically and carry out necessary planning to have a good market penetration.
	Discuss promotional strategies and activities, feedback on daily experiences, challenges, and possible ways of resolving the issues.
	Familiar with the region of operation.
	Setting goals and developing plans for business and revenue growth.
	Foster and develop relationships with customers/clients.
	Have a good understanding of the business's products or services and be able to advise others about them.
	Managing the sales process for new prospects, from initial contact through to closure.


Job Requirements


	NCE / ND / HND / BSc in Business Administration, Marketing, and any related course.
	Minimum of 1 - 2 years as a BDE in Merchant Acquiring (Entry level experience also welcomed).
	Banking firm or Direct Sales Executive in a Commercial Banks.
	Previous achievement in the field of sales/Business Development.
	Previous achievement/results driving adoption of financial products by customers.
	Strong communication and presentation skills.
	Strong marketing, engagement & negotiating skills.


Compensation


	Salary: N70,000 Gross.
	Commission: N135,000 Gross.
	Transport Allowance.

title: Creative Assistant Job at Amani Advisory Limited
content:
Amani Advisory Limited is committed to assisting organizations in achieving success by maximizing their most valuable resource - their employees. We offer complete HR solutions to businesses of all sizes and in various industries. Thanks to a team of seasoned HR professionals, we approach every project with expertise, innovation, and a client-centric mindset.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	In this role, you will support the Creative Director and design team in developing innovative and visually stunning designs.
	It is a requirement that you have a strong passion for fashion, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities


	Assist in the development of designs from concept to final product.
	Liaise with the design team, Creative Director, and other departments to ensure effective communication and collaboration.
	Maintain organized files, records, and design archives.
	Provide input on fabric selection, colour palettes, and style ideas.
	Prepare sketches, illustrations, or digital renderings as needed.
	Assist with special projects, such as fashion shows, photo shoots, and events.
	Assist in the creation and development of design concepts, mood boards, and presentations.
	Collaborate with the production team to ensure timely execution of designs.
	Maintain sample organization and oversee quality checks for prototypes and final products.
	Support in managing timelines and ensuring assigned tasks stay on schedule.
	Participate in photoshoots and provide creative direction to capture brand aesthetics.
	Assist in styling models and organizing promotional content for social media and marketing.
	Work with the marketing team to ensure cohesive visual representation across platforms.
	Maintain accurate records of materials, designs, and production notes.
	Support the creative director with day-to-day production schedules.
	Ensure all creative work aligns with the brand’s vision, values, and target audience.
	Stay updated on industry trends to provide fresh ideas and competitive insights.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Fashion Design, Fine Arts, or related field.
	1 - 2 years of experience in fashion design, styling, or a related field.
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketchbook), Microsoft Office, and Google Suite.
	Strong understanding of fashion trends, textiles, and design principles.
	Strong visual sense, attention to detail, and innovative mindset.
	Excellent multitasking abilities with a proactive and solution-oriented approach.
	Strong verbal and written communication for effective collaboration.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talent.amanisolutions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Project Officer (Surgical Care and Outreach) Job at Congenital Heart Disease Foundation of Nigeria
keyword: congenital heart disease foundation of nigeria
content:
The Congenital Heart Disease Foundation of Nigeria (CHDF) is a non-profit organization that supports children and persons with Congenital Heart Disease popularly called Hole in the Heart in Nigeria. The foundation is envisioned to be the leading charity organization in Nigeria supporting the CHD cause. Our mission “to create a paradigm shift in the current status of congenital heart disease in Nigeria through awareness campaign and advocacy; support; education and research promotion” states the 4 main areas we are focusing on to achieve our vision.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Officer (Surgical Care and Outreach)
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ogun
Employment Type: Volunteer

Role Overview


	We are seeking a passionate and committed Medical Doctor, Medical Graduate (Intern, NYSC), or Medical Student (400 level and above) to serve as a Volunteer Project Officer (Surgical Care & Outreach).
	This role is essential in supporting the planning, coordination, and monitoring of surgical care programs and outreach initiatives.
	he successful candidate will work closely with the Program Manager and clinical teams to ensure our interventions are impactful and patient-centered.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinating and sourcing for partnership/ sponsorship for patients' cardiac intervention treatments locally and internationally.
	Assist in planning and coordinating surgical missions and outreach programs.
	Track project progress and prepare reports on outcomes and impact.
	Maintain accurate documentation of surgical and outreach activities.
	Liaise with hospitals, surgical teams, and partner organizations.
	Support patient identification, screening, and follow-up processes.
	Participate in community engagement and awareness efforts.
	Contribute to a collaborative and mission-driven team environment.


Qualifications


	Must be a Medical Doctor, Medical Graduate (Interns, NYSC), Medical Student (400 level and above).
	Strong interest in surgical care, public health, and community outreach.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Experience in clinical coordination or health outreach is an advantage.
	Passion for improving the lives of individuals affected by congenital heart disease.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid setting.

title: Marketing and Sales Officer Job at Scentarcade
content:
Scentarcade - We are one of Nigeria’s leading distributors of high-quality scenting and fragrance solutions, dedicated to enhancing environments with premium aromatic experiences. With a strong presence in the market and a growing customer base, we are expanding our team to reach new heights in brand visibility and customer engagement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing and Sales Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Fragrance & Scenting Solutions

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking dynamic and results-driven Marketing and Sales Officers to join our team.
	This role involves promoting our fragrance products, identifying new business opportunities, and building strong customer relationships. Candidates must be passionate about sales, have a keen sense of marketing strategy, and possess excellent communication skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive product sales through both direct and indirect channels
	Develop and execute marketing campaigns to increase brand awareness and customer engagement
	Identify and pursue new market opportunities and client acquisition
	Maintain and grow existing customer relationships
	Collaborate with internal teams to align marketing strategies with sales goals
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Provide regular reports on sales performance and market trends.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
	2+ years of relevant experience in sales and/or marketing (experience in fragrance, FMCG, or lifestyle brands is a plus)
	Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
	Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proficiency in digital marketing and CRM tools is an advantage.


Remuneration Package


	Base Salary: N450,000/month
	Performance Bonus: Attractive commission structure based on sales targets
	Other Benefits: Professional development opportunities, performance incentives, and travel allowances (where applicable).


Method of Aplication
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: digitaleplanet@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.

title: District Manager Job at Bogo Beverages Limited
content:
Bogo Beverage Limited is a young and dynamic total manufacturing, distribution and marketing of quality beverage company, with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and growth mindset. We are determined to dominate the beverage sector with our quality brands, apt commercial acumen and cognate experience of the Nigerian consumers and Africa

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: District Manager - East
Job Location: Ebonyi / Enugu / Imo

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Drive brand penetration in both on-prem and off-prem outlets within the region.
	Understand and effectively communicate the company's vision and values.
	Responsible for driving brand visibility at the point of sales and consumption.
	Supervise the installation and maintenance of point-of-sale/ printed materials within the region.
	Assist customers with inventory management responsibilities (product availability/new product placement, and rotation of stock)
	Maintain sales volume, product mix, and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators, and competitors
	Establish and adjust selling prices by monitoring costs, competition, supply, and demand.
	Maintained sales staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees. As well as counselling and disciplining employees, planning, monitoring, and appraising job results


Requirements and Skills


	A graduate with an MBA will be an added advantage.
	Must have 9-14 years of work experience.
	Candidates must be in the wine and spirits industry.
	Proven sales experience, meeting, or exceeding targets
	Proven ability to position products against competitors.
	Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong analytical skills
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, goal-driven environment.
	The candidate should have a car and know how to drive.
	The candidate should be a resident in the East (Imo, Enugu, Ebonyi).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: careers.bogo@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
